item.description: Data manipulation and nonstate actor intrusions are among the emerging cyber threats the commander of U.S. Cyber Command and director of the National Security Agency said.
item.title: Rogers: Data Manipulation, Non-State Actor Intrusions are Coming Cyber Threats

item.description: U.S. and coalition military forces have continued to attack Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant terrorists in Syria and Iraq, Combined Joint Task Force Operation Inherent Resolve officials reported.
item.title: Military Strikes Target ISIL Terrorists in Syria, Iraq

item.description: Naval Postgraduate School student Navy Lt. Cmdr. Korban Blackburn is developing an optimization tool dubbed the Optimized Transit Tool Easy Reference, or OTTER, which has the potential to save the Navy millions in fuel costs.
item.title: Face of Defense: Sailor Advances Fuel-Saving Measures

item.description: Marine Corps Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, announced Army Command Sgt. Maj. John W. Troxell will serve as the third senior enlisted advisor to the chairman.
item.title: Dunford Chooses Korea-Based Sergeant Major as Next Senior Enlisted Advisor

item.description: Defense Secretary Ash Carter said his Force of the Future program is necessary to ensure the Defense Department continues to attract the best people America has to offer.
item.title: Carter Details Force of the Future Initiatives

item.description: The coalition fighting the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant unleashed a wave of attacks targeting ISIL's oil distribution chain, disrupting a source of revenue for the terrorists, an Operation Inherent Resolve spokesman told reporters.
item.title: OIR Spokesman: Coalition Cripples ISIL Oil Distribution

item.description: DoD officials are looking for permeability between the private and public sector, between the active-duty force and the reserve components and between military and civilian life.
item.title: Force of the Future Looks to Maintain U.S. Advantages

item.description: Before former Army Capt. Gregory David Estevez removed his uniform for the last time, the Army worked to ensure he was able to achieve a stable return to civilian life.
item.title: Injured Army Captain Makes Transition to Civilian Life

item.description: U.S. and coalition military forces have continued to attack Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant terrorists in Syria and Iraq, Combined Joint Task Force Operation Inherent Resolve officials reported.
item.title: Military Strikes Continue Against ISIL Terrorists in Syria, Iraq

item.dc_creator: Air Force Senior Airman Daniel Liddicoet, 446th Airlift Wing
item.description: Growing up in rural Tarlac province in the Philippines, Air Force Reserve Senior Airman Anne Venice Jalos, a finance manager with the 446th Airlift Wing, never envisioned that at age 19 she would be serving the U.S. military as a naturalized citizen.
item.title: Face of Defense: Airman Achieves Dream of U.S. Citizenship
